content:
Art. 4.183 
Notarial will 
A notarial will is one which is received by a civil law notary [...].1 ...]1.
A notarial will is drawn up on paper in accordance with Article 13 of the [...].1 law of 16 March 1803 containing the organisation of the notarial profession]1in accordance with the wishes expressed by the testator.
It is read to the testator who confirms that these are his last wishes. [1 ...]1
Express mention is made of the whole.
This will must be signed by the testator. If he declares that he does not know how to sign or cannot sign, his declaration and the reason which prevents him from signing shall be expressly mentioned in the instrument.
